overview/USER.html.title: Who are the users ?
overview/USER.html.body:
Who are the users ?
Are you one of those ?

Who are willing to access to the world Internet away from being blocked or over-protected
Who are willing to broaden the horizon through their own eyes and indenepent thinking
Who believe in the right to access to the most valuable treasure, knowledge and wisdom.

Brief idea
Set up your network environment by

Installation of powter-client on your router
Installation of powter-server on your VPS

Therefore, you connect yourselves to the world
Why you should use ?

One step installation to solve dns pollution and network redirection.
Works on Linux, being tested in mainly VPS provider.
It is FREE forever, forever.

overview/PROJECT.html.title: About the project
overview/PROJECT.html.body:
About the project
Milestones

Stable performance on Linux server version
Network monitor report
Web UI in powter-server

Business plan

It is FREE forever, forever.
We would like to build up the self-organized community for this project, and need all kinds of support, feed-foward from you.
The goal we care the most is enable you to access to the most valuable treasure in human history, the knowledge and wisdom.

usage/DEPENDENCY.html.title: Dependency
usage/DEPENDENCY.html.body:
Dependency
Install unzip, tree, iftop, make
sudo apt install build-essential tree unzip iftop -y

Install Docker CE 18.06 (reference)
Add current user to docker group after installation
sudo usermod -aG docker $USER

Install docker-compose command :
Install docker-compose 1.22.0 (reference)

usage/DEPLOYMENT.html.title: Deployment
usage/DEPLOYMENT.html.body:
Deployment
Download powter-server and unzip
wget  https://github.com/hilanderas/powter-server/releases/download/0.1.2/powter-server-0.1.2.zip
unzip powter-server-0.1.2.zip

Install powter-server
A info file will pop up during installation, update USER, WAN and enter :wq to save and quit
cd powter-server
make install

Check status of powter-server
make status

usage/usermanual/INFO.html.title: info
usage/usermanual/INFO.html.body:
info
info is used to customize user configuration of services. Users can modify it to meet their own requirements. 
info template
dns-proxy:
  DNSPORT: 12345:12356
  WAN: enp0s25
sskcp:
  server:
    - {key: test, listenport: 7201, log-dir: /home/USER/log, mode: sskcp}
    - {key: test, listenport: 7202, log-dir: /home/USER/log, mode: sskcp}
    - {key: test, listenport: 7203, log-dir: /home/USER/log, mode: sskcp}
    - {key: test, listenport: 7204, log-dir: /home/USER/log, mode: sskcp}

info is yaml file and you can test whether it is ok with below command:
cd powter-server
make test_info INFO=path/to/info
Detailed info about how to modify info of dns-proxy, sskcp

usage/usermanual/INSTALL.html.title: Install
usage/usermanual/INSTALL.html.body:
Install
There are 2 ways to install powter-server:

One key installationmake install


Install step by step like below:Download powter-server
wget  https://github.com/hilanderas/powter-server/releases/download/[VERSION]/powter-server-m.n.p.zip

Download images, confgenerator, images API for 2 projects
make prepare

Test whether download resources successfully
make test_prepare

Generate configuration
Provide info file, you will be asked to edit it on line, just enter :wq to save the file if you don't need to modify it.make config INFO=path/to/info

Please note that if info is not provided, a default one will pop up and you can edit it on line before save.make config

If you want script keep running without stopping, add INTRERACTION=false at the end of the command (not applicable)
make config INFO=path/to/info INTRERACTION=false

Test configuration generated
make test_config

Start services
make start

usage/usermanual/UNINSTALL.html.title: Uninstall
usage/usermanual/UNINSTALL.html.body:
Uninstall
Uninstall the services
Delete all services, default info, compose configuration  and downloaded packages
cd powter-server
make uninstall

usage/usermanual/START.html.title: Start
usage/usermanual/START.html.body:
Start
Start all services
make start
Start dns
make start_dns
Start sskcp
make start_sskcp

usage/usermanual/STOP.html.title: Stop
usage/usermanual/STOP.html.body:
Stop
Keep info, configuration
Stop all services
make stop
Stop dns
make stop_dns
Stop sskcp
make stop_sskcp

usage/usermanual/RESTART.html.title: Restart
usage/usermanual/RESTART.html.body:
Restart
Restart all services
make restart
Restart dns
make restart_dns
Restart sskcp
make restart_sskcp

usage/usermanual/CHECKSTATUS.html.title: Check status
usage/usermanual/CHECKSTATUS.html.body:
Check status

Check all services status, iptables after installation 
make status


Check dns service status, iptables after installation 
make status_dns


Check sskcp service status and docker logs after installation 
make status_sskcp

usage/usermanual/UPDATEDNS.html.title: Update dns
usage/usermanual/UPDATEDNS.html.body:
Replace dns server
Sometimes vps used as dns server is in low performance or high latency, so you want to replace it to a new one. 
There are 2 ways to do this:

Update info on line
Update info with file provided by user

Modify info on line

Modify  ip in dns-server in info popped up and save
make update


Check status
make status


Check whether configuration is updated
make showconf



Modify info file

Modify  ip in dns-server in info file and savevi /path/to/info


Update configuration
make update INFO=/path/to/info


Check status
make status


Check whether configuration is updated
make showconf

usage/usermanual/UPDATESSKCP.html.title: Update sskcp
usage/usermanual/UPDATESSKCP.html.body:
Replace sskcp server
Sometimes vps used as sskcp server is in low performance or high latency, so you want to replace it to a new one. 
There are 2 ways to do this:

Update info on line
Update info with file provided by user

Modify info on line
Modify info file

usage/usermanual/SHOWCONF.html.title: Show conf
usage/usermanual/SHOWCONF.html.body:
Show conf
Show system configuration of all services.
make showconf

usage/usermanual/RESET.html.title: Reset conf
usage/usermanual/RESET.html.body:
Reset
Reset info to default.
make reset_info

usage/testflow/DEVELOPMODE.html.title: Develop mode
usage/testflow/DEVELOPMODE.html.body:
Test flow in development mode
Git clone
git clone https://github.com/hilanderas/powter-server.git

Set as development mode

Set mode
cd powter-server/testflow/script
make set_mod TESTMODE=dev


Read mode
make -s read_mod



Initial configuration
make init_config PROJ=[PROJ]

PROJ: Path of power-server/ctl
e.g,
make init_config PROJ=/home/qa/powter-server/ctl

n
Run test flow

Preparation before test
make test_prepare


Install
  Update /home/USER in default info.yml 
make test_install


Uninstall
make test_uninstall




Install after uninstall
make test_installafteruninstall


Reinstall
make test_reinstall


Reuninstall
make test_reuninstall


Test other scenarios

test_before_reboot  
test_after_reboot 
test_restartall 
test_updateconf_dns 
test_updateconf_sskcp
test_checkconfig




Clean upmake cleanup

usage/testflow/PRODUCTIONMODE.html.title: Production mode
usage/testflow/PRODUCTIONMODE.html.body:
Test flow in production mode
Login server and install dependency

Update system
sudo apt update -y


Install make tree unzip iftop
sudo apt install build-essential tree unzip iftop -y


Install docker-ce
sudo apt install -y apt-transport-https ca-certificates curl software-properties-common
curl -fsSL https://download.docker.com/linux/ubuntu/gpg | sudo apt-key add -
sudo add-apt-repository 'deb [arch=amd64] https://download.docker.com/linux/ubuntu bionic stable'
sudo apt update -y
sudo apt install docker-ce -y
sudo usermod -aG docker $USER


Install docker-compose
sudo curl -L https://github.com/docker/compose/releases/download/1.21.2/docker-compose-`uname -s`-`uname -m` -o /usr/local/bin/docker-compose
sudo chmod +x /usr/local/bin/docker-compose
docker-compose --version


Reboot serversudo reboot



Download powter-server testflow packages
wget https://github.com/hilanderas/powter-server/releases/download/0.1.2/powter-server-testflow-0.1.2.zip
unzip powter-server-testflow-0.1.2.zip

Check releases page for other versions
Download powter-server packages
cd powter-server-testflow
make download

Config test environment

Update info.yml in powter-server-testflow to meet your test environment

Set project path, info file path and lan port 
make config PROJ=[PROJECT] IFACE=[IFACE]

Description of each attribute:

PROJ: Path of power-server
IFACE: Interface of server
  e.g,
make config PROJ=$PWD/powter-server IFACE=eth0


Check configuration
make -s read_config



Run test flow

Preparation before testmake test_prepare


Update info.yml to meet your test environment

Install
make test_install INFO=$PWD/info.yml


Uninstall
make test_uninstall


Install after uninstall
make test_installafteruninstall


Reinstall
make test_reinstall


Reuninstall
make test_reuninstall


Test other scenarios

test_before_reboot  
test_after_reboot 
test_restartall 
test_updateconf_dns 
test_updateconf_sskcp
test_checkconfig


Clean up
make cleanup
